hero.label: Navigators for the Era
hero.title: In a world that never stops shifting, we help people find their inner anchor again.
hero.subtitle: Amid structural change, era pressure, and value tension, we offer cross-disciplinary mental support—connecting reality, relationships, spirit, and future.

why.title: Why We Exist
why.intro: We live in a time of profound transition. AI and automation are reshaping work and value structures; education and career paths are fracturing; marriage and family are transforming; traditional and modern values are in tension.
why.challenges: More and more young people face lost direction, identity crisis, relationship and marriage pressure, uncertainty about work and future, and a vacuum of meaning and spirit.
why.conclusion: Mental health is no longer just personal—it is an era issue. We exist to respond to this moment.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: We help people today rediscover themselves, build stable inner structure, and reconnect with society, relationships, and meaning in a time of upheaval.
vision.believe: Mental health is not only about reducing pain—it is about rebuilding direction. True support must address psychology, social reality, philosophy and values, and spiritual and meaning exploration.

reality.title: Reality-Oriented
reality.desc: We don't avoid change or offer empty comfort. We help people understand the real world.

integrated.title: Integrated Perspective
integrated.desc: A method that integrates psychology, philosophy, social observation, and spiritual reflection.

human.title: Human-Centered
human.desc: No labeling, no ideology. Every person's experience is taken seriously.

relational.title: Relational Healing
relational.desc: Family, marriage, and social relationships are the foundation of psychological stability.

meaning.title: Meaning Restoration
meaning.desc: Helping people re-understand the meaning of work, the value of relationships, and their place in existence.

method.title: Session Format
method.desc: Online (in-person to be opened). 60 minutes per session, typically weekly; can adjust to biweekly when stable.

approach.title: Therapeutic Approach
approach.desc: Integrating psychology, philosophy, social observation, and spiritual reflection—matched to your issues and stage.

confidentiality.title: Confidentiality
confidentiality.desc: Nothing shared without your written consent. Except where law requires (e.g., immediate risk), we follow strict ethical protocols.

mission.title: Mission
mission.intro: We build a cross-disciplinary mental support model. Our goal is not to help people escape reality, but to build inner order amid disruption and find a practical path through chaos.

ai.title: AI-Era Counseling
ai.desc: Career anxiety and future-sense rebuilding; identity amid technological disruption; learning and growth strategies in an AI environment.

relationship.title: Marriage & Family Support
relationship.desc: Contemporary marriage pressure and role shifts; gender differences in psychological needs; relationship repair amid family structure change.

education.title: Education & Youth Direction
education.desc: Psychological impact of education-work disconnect; young people's direction rebuilding; life path design.

spiritual.title: Spiritual & Philosophical Exploration
spiritual.desc: Questions of meaning; tension between faith and modern society; space for deeper value dialogue.

not.title: We are not
items: A service that only offers emotional comfort

are.title: We are
are.text: Navigators for the era—a support system connecting reality, relationships, spirit, and future.

credentials.label: Credentials & Training
credentials.text: Nationally accredited counseling credentials; ongoing training in CBT, ACT, psychoanalytic approaches, and clinical supervision.

approach.label: Integrated Method
approach.text: Integrating psychology, philosophy, social observation, and spiritual reflection—first stabilizing emotion and daily function, then exploring relational patterns and core beliefs.

values.label: Values
values.text: Respect, boundaries, non-judgment. Every person's experience is taken seriously—no labeling, no ideology.

workStyle.label: Working Style
workStyle.text: Reality-oriented and goal-focused. Each phase clarifies goals, tracks progress, and plans the next practical steps.

booking.title: Booking & Fees
steps: Submit your info (name/nickname, contact, brief concern).
15-min consultation to check fit and goals.
Schedule regular sessions, frequency, and phase goals.
booking.cancelPolicy: Cancellation: Please notify at least 24 hours ahead; late cancellations incur one session fee.

privacy.title: Privacy & Confidentiality
items: Your personal data is used only for booking, sessions, and necessary communication.
Records are kept minimal with strict access control.
No disclosure to family, employers, or third parties without your consent.
Only in legally required high-risk situations (e.g., imminent harm) do we follow mandated procedures.

items.q: What happens in the first session?
items.a: We clarify your main concerns, goals, and how we'll work together—so you know what to expect.
Therapy isn't about being persuaded. It's about understanding patterns and adjusting responses through a stable, structured relationship. Change grows from ongoing collaboration.

items.q: How many sessions do I need?
items.a: Short-term work often starts with 6–12 sessions. Deeper issues (long-term patterns, trauma) may need longer.
